meta.title: District FAQ for learning at Home - Alexander Local Schools

meta.content: District FAQ for learning at Home
This FAQ contains the information you will need as we prepare to send the 1st Spring Packet out for your students.

meta.name: description
meta.content: This FAQ contains the information you will need as we prepare to send the 1st Spring Packet out for your students.

link.title: Elementary School - News

span.p: Alexander Local School District and all district facilities will be closed through the remainder of the school year. More information will be in the district news section on this website.

h1.span: District FAQ for learning at Home

img.title: image of the letters f a q
img.alt: image of the letters f a q

li.strong: How do I get my child’s school work?

ul.li: Option 1 - School Pick-Up: On Mondays outside the cafeteria entrance. For both pick-ups, please enter from Meadowbrook Road and proceed to the cafeteria parking lot. Please exit by the carwash to the highway.

Option 2 - Community Based Pick-Up: Packets will be available for pick-up at the same community-based locations as the food pick-up locations on Wednesday from 9:00-11:00 am. Parents must contact the school to make arrangements for materials to be sent to those locations.
Option 3 - Individual Home Delivery: Parents can contact the school office to arrange for home delivery if transportation limits their ability to obtain their child’s schoolwork.

li.strong: Can I have my child’s school work emailed to me?

ul.li: Some teachers are willing and able to email school work. Please contact your child’s teacher to inquire about this if you are interested. This will vary from teacher to teacher.

li.strong: How do we get access to the school provided breakfast and lunch?

ul.li: Food will be available for pick-up from 9:00-11:00 am at community-based locations on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday each week. The locations are Columbia Township Fire Department, Albany Baptist Church, Alexander Township Garage, Shade Community Center, New Marshfield Senior Center, Alexander School Cafeteria

li.strong: Can we pick up the breakfast and lunch for multiple days at one time?

ul.li: As of right, we are providing 2 days’ worth of food at a time.

li.strong: Will the packets be graded and count toward a student’s grade?

ul.li: Yes, these packets will be graded by the student’s teacher in the same fashion as they would grade typical school work and will count for the student’s 4th nine weeks grade. Teacher will be updating the grades in infinite campus as the packets are returned.

li.strong: What if my child does not do the packets?

ul.li: If a child does not complete the packets, this could negatively impact the child’s class grades for the 4th nine weeks. This could impact a student’s promotion to the following grade next year.

li.strong: How do I contact my child’s teacher?

ul.li: Email: On the district website, you can find staff email addresses in the staff directory under the district info tab.

Phone: Teachers are working remotely so they may always not be in their classrooms . You can leave a message and they will call you back. To do so, call the school at 740-698-8831 and either enter the teacher’s direct extension or have the office transfer you to the appropriate teacher.
Infinite Campus: You can message your child’s teacher through infinite campus.

li.strong: How do I get ahold of the building offices?

ul.li: The building offices will be open Monday through Friday from 8:00 to 12:00. Please call 740-698-8831 and select the appropriate option as directed.

li.strong: Can my child still access counseling services?

ul.li: Yes. The services being provided by outside agencies such as Hopewell and HRS will vary so please contact your child’s provider for further details. School counselors will be available for any students needing support. Our elementary school counselor is Ben Shultz. Our middle school counselor is Marideth Rock. Our high school counselor is Karrie Hanning. Please contact them as needed through phone or email.

li.strong: How can I get support with any technology or accounts?

ul.li: Please contact our technology department at 740-698-4585 or support@alexanderschools.org.

li.strong: What is the plan for graduation?

ul.li: Plans will be announced in May when "Shelter in Place" has been lifted. We intend to have a ceremony, but must wait to see what the Governor does in May.

li.strong: What is the plan for prom?

ul.li: Prom is postponed until further notice. We will continue to reassess this situation as future orders are given from Governor Mike DeWine.

li.strong: When is preschool and kindergarten registration?

ul.li: Preschool registration packets will be available April 14th from 11:00am-1:00pm in front of the elementary. Registration packets are due back on April 28th

Kindergarten registration packets will be available April 23rd and 24th from 8:00am-12:30pm in front of the elementary. Registration packets are due back by May 8th. They can be dropped off to the elementary office any day between 8:00am-12:00pm Monday through Friday.

li.strong: Are the school facilities open to the public?

ul.li: Our facilities are closed to the public. The track and wellness trail are open to the public for walking. Please refrain from using the athletic fields.
